t: Now*p the main point in what has been said is*i this:*i we have such a high priest, who has taken His seat at the right hand of the throne of the Majesty in the heavens,
a minister in the sanctuary and in the true tabernacle, which the Lord pitched, not man.
For every high priest is appointed to offer both gifts and sacrifices; so it is necessary that this high*i priest*i also have something to offer.
Now if He were on earth, He would not be a priest at all, since there are those who offer the gifts according to the Law;

who serve a copy and shadow of the heavenly things, just as Moses was warned by*i God*i when he was about to erect the tabernacle; for, “See,”*s He says, “that*s you*s make*s all things according*s to*s the*s pattern*s which*s was*s shown*s you*s on*s the*s mountain.”*s
But now He has obtained a more excellent ministry, by as much as He is also the mediator of a better covenant, which has been enacted on better promises.
For*p if that first covenant*i had been faultless, there would have been no occasion sought for a second.

For finding fault with them, He says, “Behold,*spn days*s are*s coming,*s says*s the*s Lord,*s When*sln I will*s effect*s a*s new*s covenant*s With*sln the*s house*s of*s Israel and*s with*s the*s house*s of*s Judah;*s

Not*sln like*s the*s covenant*s which*s I made*s with*s their*s fathers*s On*ln the*s day*s when*s I took*s them*s by*s the*s hand*s To*sln lead*s them*s out*s of*s the*s land*s of*s Egypt;*s For*sln they*s did*s not*s continue*s in*s My*s covenant,*s And*ln I did*s not*s care*s for*s them,*s says*s the*s Lord.*s

For*sln this*s is*s the*s covenant*s that*s I will*s make*s with*s the*s house*s of*s Israel After*ln those*s days,*s says*s the*s Lord:*s I*ln will*s put*s My*s laws*s into*s their*s minds,*s And*ln I will*s write*s them*s on*s their*s hearts.*s And*ln I will*s be*s their*s God,*s And*ln they*s shall*s be*s My*s people.*s

And*ln they*s shall*s not*s teach*s everyone*s his*s fellow*s citizen,*s And*ln everyone*s his*s brother,*s saying,*s ‘Know*s the*s Lord,’*s For*sln all*s will*s know*s Me,*s From*sln the*s least*s to*s the*s greatest*s of*s them.*s
For*sln I will*s be*s merciful*s to*s their*s iniquities,*s And*ln I will*s remember*s their*s sins*s no*s more.”*s
When*p He said, “A new covenant,”*i He has made the first obsolete. But whatever is becoming obsolete and growing old is ready to disappear.
